sections.heading: by defendant of sums due; stay; decree
sections.text: If, after a decree for sale, entered against a defendant in such case, he shall bring into court the principal and interest due, with costs, the proceedings in the suit shall be stayed, but the court shall enter a decree of foreclosure and sale, to be enforced

sections.heading: applicable only to cases where foreclosure is for interest or part of principal
sections.text: It was not intended to relieve party from forfeiture. Beisel v. Artman, 10 Neb. 181, 4 N.W. 1011 (1880).
